prompt: A section header component with a bold font, used to separate different areas of the website

message.content:
Here is the design and implementation of the Section Header component: **What should the UI look like?** The Section Header component should be a prominent heading that separates different areas of the website. It should have a bold font and a subtle background color to make it stand out. On smaller screens, the font size should decrease to ensure readability. **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** * `SectionHeader` (Takes Children): A heading component that separates different areas of the website. It should have a bold font and a subtle background color. **SectionHeader component properties:** * `fontSize`: `lg` on large screens, `md` on medium screens, and `sm` on small screens * `fontWeight`: `bold` * `backgroundColor`: `bg-gray-200` (a subtle gray background color) * `padding`: `py-2` (padding top and bottom) * `textColor`: `text-gray-800` (a dark gray text color) **What does the HTML for top level UI look like?** ```html
Section 1 Section 2
``` **What is the HTML for each component?** * `SectionHeader` (Takes Children): ```html

{children}

``` Note: The `children` placeholder represents the text content of the SectionHeader component.

prompt: Footer with social media links, terms of use, and privacy policy links

message.content:
Here's the design: **What should the UI look like?** The footer should have a clean and simple design, with a dark background to differentiate it from the rest of the page. The social media links should be displayed horizontally, with a slight gap between each icon. The terms of use and privacy policy links should be displayed below the social media links, centered and with a smaller font size. **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** 1. **SocialMediaLinks** (Takes Children): This component will display a list of social media links horizontally. * On small screens, the links will be stacked vertically. * On medium screens and above, the links will be displayed horizontally with a slight gap between each icon. 2. **FooterLink** (Standalone): This component will display a single link with a dark background and white text. * On all screens, the link will have a small font size and a slight padding. **What does the HTML for top level UI look like?** ```html
_twitter facebook github
{terms_of_use} {privacy_policy}
``` **What is the HTML for each component?** 1. **SocialMediaLinks** (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` 2. **FooterLink** (Standalone): ```html {text} ```

prompt: Community section header with a title and "New Discussion" button

message.content:
**1) What should the UI look like?** The community section header should have a prominent title that stands out, with a clear call-to-action (CTA) button to encourage users to start a new discussion. The title should be easy to read, and the CTA button should be prominently displayed. The design should be responsive, with the title and button adjusting to fit different screen sizes. **2) What are the individual components that make up the UI?** * **CommunitySectionHeader** (Standalone): A header component that displays the title of the community section and a "New Discussion" button. + On small screens (sm:), the title should be displayed on one line, with the "New Discussion" button on the next line. + On medium screens (md:) and above, the title and button should be displayed on the same line, with the button aligned to the right. **3) What does the HTML for top level UI look like?** ```html ``` **4) What is the HTML for each component?** * **CommunitySectionHeader** (Standalone): ```html

{community_section_title}

``` Note: `{community_section_title}` should be replaced with the actual title of the community section.

prompt: A course detail component, including a course title, description, and a list of lessons

message.content:
Here is the UI design: **What should the UI look like?** The course detail component should have a clean and simple design that effectively communicates the course title, description, and lessons. The title should be prominent and easy to read. The description should be concise and provide a brief overview of the course. The lessons should be listed in a clear and organized manner. The UI should be responsive and adapt to different screen sizes. **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** 1. `CourseTitle` (Standalone): Displays the title of the course. On smaller screens, the title should be slightly larger and centered. On larger screens, the title should be displayed on the left side of the container. 2. `CourseDescription` (Standalone): Displays a brief description of the course. The text should be concise and easy to read. On smaller screens, the description should be displayed below the title. On larger screens, the description should be displayed to the right of the title. 3. `LessonList` (Takes Children): Displays a list of lessons. Each lesson should be displayed as a separate item with a brief description and a link to the lesson. On smaller screens, the lessons should be displayed in a vertical list. On larger screens, the lessons should be displayed in a horizontal list with a maximum of 3 lessons per row. **What does the HTML for top level UI look like?** ```html
{lessons.map((lesson) => ( ))}
``` **What is the HTML for each component?** - `CourseTitle` (Standalone): ```html

{courseTitle}

``` - `CourseDescription` (Standalone): ```html

{courseDescription}

``` - `LessonList` (Takes Children): ```html
    {children}
``` - `Lesson` (Standalone): ```html

  • {lessonTitle}

    {lessonDescription}

    Learn More
    • ``` Note: I used Tailwind CSS classes to style the components. I assume that `course_title`, `course_description`, and `lessons` are placeholders for the actual data.

prompt: Design a community news section with a list of article titles, summaries, and thumbnails

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The community news section should have a clean and modern design, with a focus on showcasing article titles, summaries, and thumbnails in a clear and organized manner. The layout should be responsive, with a single-column layout on mobile devices and a multi-column layout on larger screens. **Individual Components** 1. **NewsArticleCard** (Takes Children): A single news article card component that displays the article title, summary, and thumbnail. * Mobile: Takes up the full width of the screen, with a stacked layout for title, summary, and thumbnail. * Tablet: Takes up half the width of the screen, with a side-by-side layout for title and summary, and a smaller thumbnail below. * Desktop: Takes up one-third of the screen width, with a side-by-side layout for title, summary, and thumbnail. 2. **NewsList** (Takes Children): A container component that holds a list of NewsArticleCard components. * Mobile: Displays a single column of news articles, with a scrollable list. * Tablet: Displays two columns of news articles. * Desktop: Displays three columns of news articles. **Top-Level UI HTML** ```html

Community News

``` **Component HTML** 1. **NewsArticleCard** (Takes Children): ```html

{article_title}

{summary}

{children}
``` 2. **NewsList** (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` Note: `{thumbnail_url}`, `{article_title}`, and `{summary}` are placeholders for the actual data, and `{children}` is a placeholder for the child components (in this case, the NewsArticleCard components).

prompt: **Category Badge**: A small rectangular component with a colored background, displaying the news article's category (e.g. Politics, Sports, etc.)

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The Category Badge component should be a small, rectangular element with a colored background that displays the news article's category. It should be compact and easily readable on various screen sizes. On smaller screens, the badge should be smaller to accommodate the limited space, while on larger screens, it can be slightly larger to make it more prominent. **Components** 1. **CategoryBadge** (Standalone) * Purpose: Display the news article's category with a colored background. * Small screens (sm:): Compact, 20px height, 40px width, 4px border radius, 8px font size. * Medium screens (md:): Slightly larger, 24px height, 48px width, 6px border radius, 10px font size. * Large screens (lg:): Prominent, 28px height, 56px width, 8px border radius, 12px font size. **HTML for Top Level UI** ```html
Politics Sports Entertainment
``` **HTML for each component** - **CategoryBadge** (Standalone): ```html {children} ``` Note: `{category_color}` should be replaced with the actual color for the category (e.g. politics: `bg-red-500`, sports: `bg-green-500`, etc.).

prompt: A progress bar component that displays a user's progress towards their fitness goals

message.content:
Here's a possible design for a progress bar component: **What should the UI look like?** The progress bar should be a horizontal bar that fills up as the user progresses towards their fitness goals. The bar should be colored with a bright, motivational color to encourage the user to reach their goals. A subtle gradient effect can be added to give the bar some depth and dimension. The bar should also have a clear label indicating the user's progress, such as "60% complete". **Components:** 1. ProgressBar (Takes Children): A horizontal progress bar that fills up as the user progresses towards their fitness goals. 2. ProgressBarLabel (Standalone): A text label that displays the user's progress as a percentage. **Top-level UI HTML:** ```html
``` **Component HTML:** - ProgressBar (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` - ProgressBarLabel (Standalone): ```html

{progress_percentage}% complete

``` Note: `{primary_color}`, `{secondary_color}`, `{highlight_color}`, and `{text_color}` should be replaced with actual colors from the consistent color palette. `{progress_percentage}` should be replaced with the actual percentage of progress.

prompt: **Hero Section:** A full-width image component with a blurred background, overlaying a white, bold, and centered title (e.g., "Cooking Inspiration") and a smaller subtitle (e.g., "Explore Our Recipes").

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The Hero Section should be a full-width, high-impact section that grabs the user's attention. It should have a blurred background image, with a bold and centered title and a smaller subtitle. The background image should be responsive and scale well on different screen sizes. The title and subtitle should be easy to read and understand, with a clear hierarchy of information. **Components:** * `HeroSection` (Standalone): The top-level component that contains the background image, title, and subtitle. * `BackgroundImage` (Standalone): A full-width, blurred background image. * `HeroTitle` (Standalone): A bold, centered title. * `HeroSubtitle` (Standalone): A smaller, centered subtitle. **HTML for the top-level UI:** ```html
{title} {subtitle}
``` **HTML for each component:** * `BackgroundImage` (Standalone): ```html ``` * `HeroTitle` (Standalone): ```html

{title}

``` * `HeroSubtitle` (Standalone): ```html

{subtitle}

``` Note: The `image_url` and `image_alt` placeholders should be replaced with the actual URL and alt text of the background image. The `title` and `subtitle` placeholders should be replaced with the actual title and subtitle text.

prompt: A "Loading..." animation with a spinning globe icon

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The UI should display a spinning globe icon with a loading text next to it, indicating that the application is currently loading. The globe should spin smoothly to show that the application is actively loading. The text "Loading..." should be displayed in a prominent font to inform the user about the loading state. The UI should be responsive, accessible, and work well on different screen sizes. **Individual components:** 1. **LoadingIndicator** (Standalone): This component displays a spinning globe icon and the "Loading..." text. * On small screens (sm:), the component should take up the full width of the screen and have a smaller font size for the text. * On medium screens (md:), the component should have a larger font size for the text and more spacing around the globe icon. * On large screens (lg:), the component should have an even larger font size for the text and more spacing around the globe icon. **HTML for top level UI:** ```html
``` **HTML for each component:** - **LoadingIndicator** (Standalone): ```html

Loading...

``` Note: The `animate-spin` class is a utility class in Tailwind CSS that adds a spinning animation to the globe icon.

prompt: A footer component with a dark background and white text, including links to social media and contact information

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The footer component should have a dark background with white text, which will provide a clear contrast and make the text easily readable. The component should be responsive, scaling well on different screen sizes. On smaller screens, the links and contact information should be stacked, while on larger screens, they can be displayed side by side. **Components** 1. **FooterComponent** (Standalone) * Purpose: Display contact information and links to social media. * Description: + On small screens (sm:), the footer will have a dark background with white text, and the links and contact information will be stacked vertically. + On medium screens (md:), the footer will maintain its dark background and white text, and the links and contact information will be displayed side by side. + On large screens (lg:), the footer will have more horizontal padding, and the links and contact information will be displayed side by side with more horizontal space between them. 2. **SocialMediaLink** (Takes Children) * Purpose: Display a link to a social media platform. * Description: A simple anchor element with a white text color and a hover effect. **Top-Level UI HTML** ```html
Contact Us
{address}
{email}
Follow Us
``` **Component HTML** - **FooterComponent** (Standalone): ```html
``` - **SocialMediaLink** (Takes Children): ```html {children} ```
